GDPR Compliance

Your Data, Your Rights. How Trace'N Find complies with the GDPR.

Last updated: October 28, 2025

1. Our Commitment to GDPR

Trace'N Find is a project developed at the **German-Malaysian Institute (GMI)** and is committed to the principles of data protection and privacy. We recognize the importance of the **General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)** and strive to ensure our service is compliant. This document outlines your rights as a user under GDPR and how we implement them.

2. Your Data Protection Rights

As a user of our Service, you have specific rights regarding your personal data. We provide you with the tools to exercise these rights directly through your account dashboard.

A. The Right to Access

You have the right to access the personal information we hold about you. You can view most of this data at any time by logging into your account.

  • **How to use it:** Your **Profile** page shows your account details. Your **Dashboard** and **Devices** pages show your device information and its current status.

B. The Right to Rectification

You have the right to request that we correct any information you believe is inaccurate or incomplete.

  • **How to use it:** You can update your `username`, `phone` number, and other profile details directly from your **Profile** or **Settings** page.

C. The Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten)

You have the right to request that we erase your personal data, under certain conditions.

  • **How to use it:** You can delete your account from your **Account Settings** page. This action will permanently delete your account, your personal data, all registered devices, and all associated location history from our database.

D. The Right to Restrict Processing

You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data. For example, you can temporarily disable tracking for a specific device.

  • **How to use it:** You can disable the "Enable Location Tracking" feature for any device from its **Device Settings** page.

E. The Right to Data Portability

You have the right to request that we transfer the data we have collected to another organization, or directly to you. This applies to data you have provided to us, such as your location history.

  • **How to use it:** You can export your location history for a specific device from the **Location History** page.

3. Data Controller

For the purpose of the GDPR, the **Data Controller** of your personal information is Trace'N Find, c/o German-Malaysian Institute.

4. Legal Basis for Processing

We process your personal data on the following legal bases:

  • **Consent:** When you create an account and add a device, you give us explicit consent to collect and process its location data for the purpose of providing the Service.
  • **Contractual Necessity:** We must process your account information (like your email) to fulfill our Terms of Service, such as allowing you to log in.

5. Contact Us

If you have any questions about our GDPR compliance or wish to exercise any of your rights, please contact us:

  • By email: dpo@trace-n-find.com (Data Protection Officer)
  • By visiting our Contact Page.
